## Introductory module

*Objectives: set expectations; explore data science raison d'etre; introduce systems and design thinking; introduce software tools and collaborative coding; conduct exploratory/descriptive analysis of class background and interests.*

### Week 0

-   ***Thursday meeting:*** Course orientation [\[slides](slides/week0-intro.qmd)\]

-   ***Assignments*** due by next class meeting:

    -   install course software and join github org;

    -   fill out intake form;

    -   read [Peng, R. D., & Parker, H. S. (2022). Perspective on data science. *Annual Review of Statistics and Its Application*, *9*, 1-20.](https://doi.org/10.1146/annurev-statistics-040220-013917) (access online via UCSB library);

    -   prepare a [reading response](https://forms.gle/PdRWx7h4PmeGQUBL8)

### Week 1 {#sec-week-1}

-   ***Tuesday meeting:*** On projects in(volving) data science [\[slides](slides/week1-perspectives.qmd)\]

-   ***Section meeting:*** software and technology overview [\[activity](labs/lab1-setup/lab1-setup.qmd)\]

-   ***Thursday meeting:*** basic GitHub actions \[activity\]

### Week 2

-   ***Tuesday meeting:*** Introducing class intake survey data \[slides\]

-   ***Section meeting:*** tidyverse basics \[activity\]

-   ***Thursday meeting:*** Exploratory/descriptive analysis of class survey data \[activity\]
